body_html:
I tried CUDA 8. I got errors. Do you know if CUDA 8 works on g2.2xlarge instances with the NVIDIA GK104GL [GRID K520]? $ lspci | grep -i nvidia 00:03.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GK104GL [GRID K520] (rev a1)
…
On Mar 31, 2017, at 10:40 AM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote: It seems you are using a mix of cuda 7 and cuda 7.5? Please try CUDA 8. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8877 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AC9i20n-sqbbFXCVQyJ-roJPglota2VFks5rrTqGgaJpZM4Mv8Hb>.
body_text:
I tried CUDA 8.  I got errors.  Do you know if CUDA 8 works on g2.2xlarge instances with the NVIDIA GK104GL [GRID K520]?

$ lspci | grep -i nvidia
00:03.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GK104GL [GRID K520] (rev a1)
…
 On Mar 31, 2017, at 10:40 AM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote:

 It seems you are using a mix of cuda 7 and cuda 7.5? Please try CUDA 8.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8877 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AC9i20n-sqbbFXCVQyJ-roJPglota2VFks5rrTqGgaJpZM4Mv8Hb>.
body:
I tried CUDA 8.  I got errors.  Do you know if CUDA 8 works on g2.2xlarge instances with the NVIDIA GK104GL [GRID K520]?

$ lspci | grep -i nvidia
00:03.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GK104GL [GRID K520] (rev a1)


> On Mar 31, 2017, at 10:40 AM, Andrew Selle <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> It seems you are using a mix of cuda 7 and cuda 7.5? Please try CUDA 8.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/8877#issuecomment-290778962>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AC9i20n-sqbbFXCVQyJ-roJPglota2VFks5rrTqGgaJpZM4Mv8Hb>.
